meanings.definition: To put into or carry in a bucket.
meanings.sent1: She bucketed the apples from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The farmer bucketed water from the well.
meanings.sent3: The kids bucketed sand to build a castle.
meanings.sent4: He bucketed his tools into the shed at the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The hiker bucketed berries in the forest for a snack.

meanings.sent1: The horse bucketed across the field.
meanings.sent2: The car bucketed down the bumpy road.
meanings.sent3: The wind bucketed through the open window.
meanings.sent4: The ball bucketed into the goal with great speed.
meanings.sent5: The excited dog bucketed towards its owner.

meanings.definition: To experience a sudden and heavy rain.
meanings.sent1: We were bucketed on our walk and got soaked.
meanings.sent2: The picnic was bucketed on, so we had to move indoors.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected storm bucketed down just as we left the house.
meanings.sent4: The garden was bucketed on, making the flowers bloom.
meanings.sent5: The roof bucketed under the weight of the rain.
